title: Media Advisory: Learn More about Water in Your Community

und.value:
Who:  U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) scientists from the Raleigh area and local students

What: Education activity for local students to learn from water experts about the water resources in the Triangle area. Activities will include hands-on experiments.  Students will see, touch, and try on specialized gear used during water testing; and play interactive games to build and test their water knowledge. This is also an opportunity to interview scientists about water quality trends in the Raleigh area.

When and Where:

Friday, October 10 

10am - 1:30 pm -- Four 45 minute  sessions with 30 children each session

Kerr YMCA

2500 Wakefield Pines Dr.

Raleigh, NC 27614

and

Friday, October 17

12 noon - 2:30 pm -- Three 45 minute sessions with 30 children per session

A.E. Finley YMCA

9216 Baileywick Rd.

Raleigh, NC 27615

Why:  This event celebrates the 20-year partnership between the USGS and local governments to track water-quality conditions in many of the area's rivers and water-supply reservoirs. For more information about this project and other USGS activities in North Carolina, see:  http://nc.water.usgs.gov/
